title: Probability
text: The first step is calculating the probability of flipping a diamond in one turn. To calculate the probability, we divide the number of cards with the desired outcome by the total number of possible outcomes.

title: Possible Outcomes

title: Desired Outcome
text: How many cards have a diamond? This is the number of cards with the desired outcome.

title: Ten Turns
text: To find the number of times we should flip a diamond in ten turns, we can multiply the probability of flipping a diamond in one turn by the number of turns.

title: Rounding
text: Round $$\frac{5}{2}$$ down to the nearest whole number.
